page.title: 06The Guildhall of Boston.
page.content: The Guildhall is a fine 15th century brick building.The cells where the Pilgrim fathers were once imprisoned still remain.After the guilds were abolished, the hall was used as the towns hall, and the chief place of civic entertainment for more than 300 years.Today it is a museum of history costing about 30p to get in.Below the stairs,is the most interesting feature is an old kitchen and fireplace with spits for large scale roasting and the which the Pilgrim fathers were imprisoned after attempting to leave England. The Pilgrim Monument,Boston. Long ago there was a group of puritans who were going to sail to North America in a ship called the"Mayflower."They were captured going down the Haven and were imprisoned in the Guildhall at Boston.
